title: Static friction - time for coin to slip

content.description: A small coin is at rest on a rough horizontal surface, where the coefficient of static friction between the coin and the surface is <math alttext="mu sub s" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>μ</mi> <mi>s</mi> </msub> </math>. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the surface begins moving to the right with an increasing acceleration equal to <math alttext="a of t equals b t" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"> <mi>b</mi> </math> is a positive constant.
content.question: At what time does the coin start slipping relative to the surface?
